 java.lang.String getBestWord(java.lang.StringBuffer mix)
          out of 9 letters form the longest word that exists in the dictionary so this is how we do it: instead of forming all possibilities out of 9 letters which could reach infinity we iterate through all words in dictionary and see if the word could be formed out of the 9 letters then we return the longest match [alternative approach using a sorted list against lengths of strings in the dictionary or through another interface to it]

getBestWord

public java.lang.String getBestWord(java.lang.StringBuffer mix)
out of 9 letters form the longest word that exists in the dictionary so this is how we do it: instead of forming all possibilities out of 9 letters which could reach infinity we iterate through all words in dictionary and see if the word could be formed out of the 9 letters then we return the longest match [alternative approach using a sorted list against lengths of strings in the dictionary or through another interface to it]

Parameters:
mix - StringBuffer 9 letters buffer
Returns:
String

canMutate

public boolean canMutate(java.lang.StringBuffer mix,

if we can constitute target string from a mix of letters then we can do the mutation and return true

Parameters:
mix - StringBuffer
target - StringBuffer
Returns:
boolean

getBestResult

public char[] getBestResult(int[] list,
                            int res)
passing a list of integers, find the sequence of operations + - * / to get the result passed try all possibilties tell one is found or none no association or precedence is considered

Parameters:
list - int[]
res - int
Returns:
char[]
